review: I've been waiting to try there burgers and I'm so happy that they opened a location close to home!  Let me just start off by saying that I'm truly pissed a t myself for not taking a picture before I had my burger.  It looked so good and I was starving that it totally slipped my mind!  Boo me...will add a pic the next time I stop in & I will definitely be back.  Let me start off by saying that the restaurant was clean and the table set up was relaxing and comfortable where you are not stacked up on top of each other.  Even though the ambience is casual, it could also be a place to have a lunch or dinner date. My waitress (think her name was Jaylene) was pleasant and nice and so helpful when I couldn't decide which burger to order.   Upon the server's suggestion, I decided to order the Prime Chophouse minus the cheese and it was delicious!  The burger was moist and juicy and the horseradish flavor on the mushrooms was just enough to give it a kick without it being too spicy.  The crunchy onions inside was also a good, giving the burger a nice crunch with each bite.   For my side, I ordered the garlic fries (minus the cheese)  which was flavorful and had the right amount of garlic making it not too overpowering.   Overall, I would give Red Robin a 5 but I need to minus half a star because the server should have reminded me that if I wanted to order the garlic fries instead of the regular fries, there would be an upcharge of  $0.99.  I did see it on the menu, but a reminder from the server at time of ordering is better than seeing it on the check at the end of the meal.  The other half star minus would have to go to the burger being cooked well done.  I asked for it to be cooked medium with a little pink, but when I cut into it, the burger was fully cooked.  I didn't ask them to redo the burger because even though it was a bit overcooked for my preference, it was still moist and juicy...that, I can forgive them for.  I will definitely be back for another visit with pics!

As someone who's been to Red Robin multiple times in Maryland I'm a huge fan. The Banzai Burger is far and away my favorite burger (even as someone who's been to Charm City multiple times). I was excited that one opened up near me. I'll start my review by stating that I ordered to go as opposed to eating in. This is the only reason why my review is 4 as opposed to 5 stars. I called them asking if I could order take out and was told I'd be transferred to the bar. After 10-15 minutes on hold I hung up and tried again, only to be told that the only way I could get to go was if I walked in and ordered it. That's fine, but I wish I hadn't been put on hold for so long for nothing. That's where my issues with my experience here end. I went to the bar and proceeded to place my order. I can be kind of picky so I order my burger with a lot of customizations which I was concerned would be an issue for a new staff, especially someone who was a bartender-first. She nailed everything down pat though, and my burger came exactly as I ordered. I had multiple staff members come up to me while I was waiting for my food ask me if I had already been helped. They were very nice and concerned which I was appreciative of. I'm normally not a huge fan of their fries (outside of the fact that you get unlimited of them) but these were well more seasoned and crispier than what I normally have when out of town. The burger was right on point how I remember, the teriyaki sauce on the burger patty was great like usual. The place looked nice too. Much more adult oriented and less cheesy than the one I've been to up north. I look forward to returning here soon and seeing how the dine in experience compares.

Best new restaurant in town. Food was exactly what I ordered and cooked to perfection. The hostess was very pleasant and helpful. Our server was also very courteous and helpful when the kitchen made a mistake on the sweet potato fries.  Thank you Red Robin. We will be frequenting this establishment often.

Waste of time.   It is McDonald's with servers and a bar.  (But usually the bread isn't stale at McD.)   So... 3 of us go, the wait staff is pleasant, but totally untrained. I watched a server lean on a table with her elbows while taking orders.  I heard a server say  (in a good mood)  "so... do you want it pink or not".  They are just not trained how to talk and work with customers, but again they were all pretty nice. The food was just adequate:  stale rolls,  bearable fries, tasteless burgers. No reason to return.  Lots of better choices.  You can get hamburgers anywhere. The two popular burger specialty chains and the local chain all out class this place.  And they are all within a mile of this location.

The service and atmosphere are much better than the Pembroke Pines location but is still lackluster. Our waitress forgot our appetizer despite being reminded of it.  At least they had enough decency to take it off the bill rather than bring out later while you are already finished with your main meal.  You definitely want to eat here during the week and avoid the weekends because it becomes overcrowded and the service declines as a result.  We ate here during the week and the service was outstanding. The food is pretty on par with most locations.

After waiting 45 minutes for our order, our burgers and fries finally arrived.  Everything was cold.  Our pleasant waitress took everything back and after another 15 minutes, we received hot food.  The manager came over to apologize.  Larger burgers can be found elsewhere.  Food only average.  We will not return.  Very disappointing.

Okay so all of the hype isn't worth it I guess. Horrible experience at this location to start it off.  First we are greeted by the manager who seemed nice, he sat us and said our server would be with us shortly. After sitting for 15-20 mins we still never saw a sever(mind you we went on a wed night and there was only about 25-30 people dining at the time). We saw all of the servers as the all passed our table with none of them even acknowledging our existence. Finally we ask for the manager and tell him the situation he grabs a server (Gary) who proceeds to tell us how this isn't his section and points out his tables that he does serve.  At this point our "server" is just going on and on about how he doesn't know who has this section.   Needless to say we gave up on this location and will not return at all. I am not a picky person but when I go to a restaurant I do expect a certain level of service.

Back again.  This trip was my get $20 off the check. As usual the short stack onion rings. Yumm. Mom had the smoke and pepper burger again with sweet potato fries.  They were ok. I had the fish and chips. Really good and big portion.  Once again, a happy camper.

Underwhelmed!  For such a long time I had seen the commercials and even sang along "Reeedddd Robin!" but on my first visit, I was unfortunately underwhelmed.  It was actually more of a dining experience then I thought.. think Chilis or TGI Fridays with burgers and drinks..  Didn't have any  of the alcoholic drinks so I can't vouch for those but they "looked good".  Service is average, not super fast but not unbearably slow either.  Plan ahead if you're trying to catch a movie or something of the like.

I've always seen those crazy commercials advertising Red Robin on TV for years, but never seen an actual restaurant so when I arrived, I was surprised to see a full service restaurant for what I had thought was a fast food restaurant. It was more or less what you would expect from a typical casual style restaurant chain, offering bottomless beverages, such as Strawberry Lemonade. Decent cocktails like the Strawberry Lemon Vojito. Appetizers including some really good, spicy wings and chips known as the Bar Wings 'n' Yukon Chips. And the usual dessert options, such as the Gooey Chocolate Brownie Cake (that sounded good, but was served cold so it really wasn't). However, the burgers were much better than I had expected. They were in fact, as gourmet as they claimed to be. There are various option (buns, toppings, etc). Best of all, if you are not enticed by the menu options, you could always make it your own. Good burgers is what Red Robin is all about.
Grease, grease, and more grease! The burgers are nothing special and are usually just a greasy, messy, disappointment.  The fries are good though

I'm giving Red Robin 4 stars simply because I really did like it. I love the decor (retro old school) and the service (been 3 times so far) has been quite good as in better than expected. Friendly server, attentive, no issues at all. I will also say I'm pretty low maintenance when dining out. So far tried the burgers, fish sandwich, their fries, shakes and crispy onion rings OMG! It's alot to share. The only thing I did not like was being seated around families with small children and then feeling as if I have to yell to talk to my friends. In the future I will ask for a quieter area around no kids. Other than that, I loved it. Great place to go to for a quick bite kind of like a TGI Fridays feel. It's really close to the new movie theater so that's even better. Update 6/2015: After visiting many times since it's opened I'd like to say the food is consistently good. The service can be great, just OK or pretty bad depending on your server. I've had some amazing attentive servers in the past but today I had someone who was absolutely awful. Had to ask for silverware, napkins, mustard & my shake took Forever! I'll still go back though because this does not happen often but if it does happen to you, give them another shot. You may get one of the good ones next time!

After an afternoon of shopping we wanted quick and fast (and within my diet restrictions) for a late lunch. My hubby chose Reeeeedddddd Robin.  Our server Tanya was great, she anticipated our needs and was very attentive.    I had the fish and chips. Which I pulled the breading off and ate only the fish.  It was so good.  Even without the breading it was very flavorful.  Hubby had the royal red robin, which he said would have been better if they had prepared the egg how he specified.  For this reason I gave them 3 stars.  Hubby loooooved his root beer float and is currently complaining of the "itis"

This is the second time I have eaten at Red Robin in the Broward Mall. The food was delicious as ever but the service was horrible. My wife ordered a salad and a root beer float, I ordered a Banzai Burger, root beer float and pretzel appetizer. The floats took forever, arriving just ahead of the entrees, no appetizers. I ended up canceling them to the dismay of our server. We finally flagged down a manager to get the floats refilled as our server had disappeared yet again. A table near us kept trying to get their check, from the time we sat down until shortly before we left. No explanation was offered, just a mumbled "sorry" from our server. I hope the manage to get it together because the food is great and the location is a good one I would hate to see them fail on staffing issues.

Reading the reviews I was shocked that ppl expect fine dining from a burger joint. Lighten up ppl. As for bad service..... I had the complete opposite! My waitress's name was Anyea and she rocked! She was sweet, attentive, she made suggestions.... And smiled the whole time. This was my daughters first time here and she said it was the best burger she ever had. Even tho she's 9, I agree! If you're coming here.... You must order a burger.... They're awesome! You wouldn't go to a Mexican restaurant and order a burger would u? Be wise.... And order what the place is known for.  We were sat right away.... No wait.... It's Saturday lunch time. My daughter was given a balloon when we left. So as for not being family friendly in a past review I read..... Get a grip buddy..... They just have rules about sitting kids at a bar..... I'm sure u would've complained if u were on a date and there were kids at the bar area... Some ppl just love to complain. This place was perfect for the expectations I had. I will be back!

Went again after the last time which had horrible service. They did give me a giftcard for the trouble and tonight, I used it. Again, the service was slow. Took 10 min just to have someone ask us what we want for drinks. Cocktails take up to 10-15 min to wait for(unacceptable). The food is OK. Mediocre. I would recommend just sitting at the bar for drinks.

I ordered two burgers; one for me and one for a friend. When we got to our destination we realized that we got the wrong order. It was raining heavily and I called Red Robin to see what could be done. Going back to the restaurant was not an option so the manager I spoke to assured me that my next order would be on the house.  Of course when I did go to get said burger, I was told that that conversation had never happened and my transaction from that night to prove I was their had mysteriously disappeared. I had to actually print my bank statement to prove I was telling the truth. Thank goodness I paid with my card. When I finally get get my burger, it was sloppy, tasteless and the fries were soggy. A little salt and pepper helps Red Robin! I am NEVER going back! Absolutely terrible service and food.

We finally got a Red Robin down here about 6 months ago; so you could say I'm new to this place. In 6 months I've been here about 6 times. I was sold after my first visit.  Now I'm a burger girl! I love me a good burger! I really enjoy red Robin because they have so many different burgers to choose from and they all really do taste different. I've never been disappointed when I've gone. They have good drink specials as well. I've never had their rootbeer float, but like their fries, they are bottomless too.  I've been to Burger-Fi and yes I do like that place as well. They also have "several" choices. But I feel like regardless what kind of burger you get there, they all taste the same.  Here at Red Robin not only are the flavored different but so are the condiments and the bread depending on what you get.  If you've never been, trust me, give it a try you won't regret it!

Disappointed. I rarely throw away food, but most of this meal's final resting was the garbage.  Greeted about 3 mins after sitting at the bar. PROMPTLY told the cost after placing my order, then waited for what seemed like an eternity (30 mins or so) for my order to arrive from the kitchen, only for it to sit on the counter several more minutes before it was brought over to me. I resisted the urge to gesture as if tapping an imaginary bell and shout "pick it up!"   The Jump Starter Double-Pick 2 $7 appetizer of fresh fried zucchini & sweet potato fries was horrible--cold, not lukewarm, but cold like the food had been cooked days ago. The floury breading on the huge bland soggy chunks of zucchini fell off easily. The California Chicken sandwich was decent, large portion and moist, but also very bland.  The sandwich includes a side of fries which explains the $10 cost.  Nice warm decor. Heads up, that there is a reserved parking space for RR take out customers, very convenient in the mall lot.

First time at a Red Robin. I was hesitant at first because of the mixed reviews but decided to check it out. Amazingly long drink and food menu. If you like options, this place is for you. They have even have gluten free options. The margarita was delicious, the food was fresh and well seasoned and the service was quick and accommodating. We had the bottomless steak fries which were hot and crisp, the patty melt and the cheeseburger were made to order and delicious. Maybe they have improved their service a bit too much and our waitress was coming by every few minutes to check up on us. Otherwise, it would have been a full 5 star rating for a burger joint. Would definitely come back.

I have visited this location several times and it's always the same for me.  The food is alright, but the service and wait time are no good.  I have never gotten my food in under 30 minutes, and all I ever get is a burger and fries.  I have been sat without being attended (15 minutes) and finally flagged down the manager and he got someone to help us.  I could live without this place, plenty of other places nearby to eat.

Stopped in last night after a movie. I was told there would be a 15 minute wait, even though I could see booths open.  The waiter was a bit absent minded, but I ignored it, I was hungry and didn't mind as long as the food was on its way. I ordered the bacon cheeseburger and a Sweet Water 420 (the beer was awesome). When the burger came out, I started preparing it with some seasoning and a side of fresh jalapeños that I had ordered. It looked so good, I was ready to dig in.  Red Robin burgers are huge and usually require a knife to cut them into a manageable size. The space cadet we had as a waiter had forgotten the silverware.  I'm sitting there, staring at that delicious looking burger, impatiently waiting for some silverware. It finally arrived. Unfortunately, the silverware wasn't the only thing wrapped in napkins. 4 pieces of curly hair were intertwined between the fork and the knife. My appetite instantly vanished.  I requested the manager and he assured me that the food was hair free. I had a hard time believing that, considering the disgusting silverware that I had just seen. The waiter apologized, but I assured him it wasn't necessary as the hair was clearly not his. The manager offered a gift card.  If I ever want a hairy meal, I know just the place and I've got a gift card for it.

I have never been a huge fans of their food per se. What I mostly liked from them were the garlic fries which helped by being bottomless. However, my kids are really into this place and so for New Year's Day they wanted to eat here and we went. However, I found out that they had changed their garlic fries to this new recipe of herbed garlic fries Who ever thought of this made the wrong decision. The fries were terrible. They were tasteless and the new herbed garlic powder made them extremely dry. My daughter was also dissatisfied with them. I doubt we will be going there anywhere near the future.
Love it. Will def be coming back. Best Clam Chowder I've ever had. Service could've been a touch faster but it was a busy night so not holding it against them.

I keep thinking we should have left at the first sign of a problem.  Four of us went to Red Robin for dinner about 7:30 on a Thursday night. We were seated right away. Then the wait started. A waitress walked around us helping other tables. Se was very good at never making eye contact with us. After 10 minutes of this game i got the hostess to order our drinks. About that time another waiter helped a table that was seated next to us. I over heard h tell the table that they were not in his section, but he would help them anyway. Our waitress comes by and says "oh good you got drinks already" she went on to tell us that the hostess is supposed to get our drink order. Whatever... Moving on... We got our food... Saluted mushroom burger is missing parmesan spread, waitress claims it doesn't come with spread. Guacamole Bacon Burger is missing guacamole. The waitress claims that i didn't order a Guacamole Bacon Burger. So i tell her to forget it. The manager comes over and attempts to smooth things over. I refused help since the waitress decided to make up our order on her own. We only got a drink refill because we asked and got a fry refill from the manager. We asked for more drinks and fries and received the check instead. The food was OK, nothing special. They really need to work on service.

We have actually been to this place twice in the hopes that the second time would be better than the first, and that maybe we just came at the wrong time. Both times we ate the same thing and while we both thought our burgers were "not bad" (which really means a notch above mediocre) I do remember thinking that the pineapple on my burger was the best part, which doesn't say much for the burger.. hey at least the fries are bottomless which really makes your server happy after the second trip.        We were also really excited to try this monstrosity called "The Blue Moon Milkshake" that is, that's right kids, a milkshake made with Blue Moon Belgian Style Ale. Maybe I am crazy for thinking that might be a good thing but oooh trust me it's garbage.     The worst though has to be the service. I think this place must be a maze becauae servers seem to actually get lost in the labyrinth that leads back to where minotaurs expidite the food. You would think that the place would take more pride in in their actual food especially given that there is a burger scene down here and competition is fierce, but i guess when you are just banking on people needing to eat at the mall, then Red Robin is what you get. The best thing about it there is bottomless fries. Seriously.

I like the royal robin. I usually order to go so that means ordering by the bar or picking it up by the bar. The times I order the customer service is horrible. The lady tending bar and taking orders is usually very grumpy. She's probably very tired. Oh and don't tell her she didn't get your order right she has this artic glare she gives you. I'm always nice though, simply because I want to lower the odds of someone taking their frustration on my food in a hidden corner. However, the burger, the main thing that keeps me coming back is always good. Kudos to the chef... You're the real MVP. Oh and don't forget the red sauce for your fries. I think it's a Tahitian sauce. It's so yummy in tummy it's a sweet and spicy delight!! Oh yeah and I tried the orange crime soda...I'm just not a fan.
Service extremely slow, burger Luke warm at best, good thing fries are bottomless since the portions are so small. Probably won't be back

Regulars here and love the food and especially the service. Marcus is an extremely hard working server; very attentive to all my needs and always aims to please... Not to mention, he's fast, furious and fine! Jimmy is cool too; looks like the character Daryl on The Walking Dead. I usually get the River Whiskey Burger or when feeling healthy the avo-cobb-o salad. The TNT always does the trick to help me relax too... similar to Long Island ice tea. I have yet to have Sex on the beach there but maybe next time... although they call it something else.. Sand in your shorts. Lol.

Had never been to this place before and came recommended. However upon our arrival our waitress was less than helpful. Didn't know the happy hour specials and instead of checking simply said I don't know.  Ordered a salad, it was good until I found not one but two bugs in my salad. Super gross couldn't believe it.  Was given a French onion soup as a replacement. However the French onion soup was so horrible I took two bites. No cheese on the soup and the onions were huge and hard.  Needless to say i won't be back and don't recommend you subject yourself to this either. It sucks

First, let me say the presentation of food and shakes has RISEN Up!  Makes a world of change! Thumbs up!  Now I've been here at various times and experienced no rush to rush times. This is where you can really see a true test. The burgers are really good, not greasy - But Burger End Preparer please double check ticket for items to leave OFF. A mystery sauce on the bottom of my burger will make me gag!  Next up- Managers on Duty how do you want your customers to feel? Welcomed right?! Sure, it begins with your mgmt style and SMILING trickles down to the "core" the Employees! Happy Employees really can save a business!  Servers- please don't mess up my ticket, if you do I'm going to ask you about it, and own up the err and press on with a SMILE!  Rushes can bring gold to servers if they will breathe and be organized! You got This! I've been a server and yes restaurants are hard to work in if the Right Mgmt style is not there. I tend to over tip and tip on to-go orders.  I'm giving 4stars now. A bit of finesse and this place will hum like a fine car! Bring IT! I know it's there! The Head Manager who opened this store is good. Loosen Up and appreciate customers want to come, don't drive me off!

Red Robins opened up at Broward Mall awhile ago. Never got around to trying it until today. I must say I was not impressed. Food was just okay. Just a step above fast food quality, and for 10$+ per burger, I expected better.  Would not go back again.
I've been here twice good experience.  The staff is great and extremely friendly. Love the nacho crunch burger; fiery burger for my pepper lovers. Let's not forget those steak fries  RED ROBIN YUM

I'm going to keep this as short as possible. I came here with my family today for a meal before we went to the movies. The service was horrible. We ordered root beer floats. We received the root beer but never the ice cream that went along with it. We were there for almost 15 minutes. My daughter ordered a milkshake, that also never made it out. I ordered a burger meal and asked for our fries to come out first. When they arrived, the server brought out the wrong type ( I wanted sweet potato fries). When we informed her of the mistake she actually had an attitude. Someone came in after us and received their appetizer before we received our drinks (root beer floats and milk shake). When we finally informed the manager and she didn't seem to concerned about the service either. By that time we decided it would be better if we just left. I didn't want to continue with the horrible service and run the jeopardy of someone contaminating my food. My advice is to stay away ... At least until they fix their customer service problem.
just ok! not worth the price, service was good, but food was just average!

Really torn with my rating because there were good aspects and not so good but a solid 3.5 stars so I rounded up.  Having never been to a Red Robin but seeing countless commercials for years before there was one actually local,  I didn't know what to expect.  However I was in the mood for good, American comfort food- so much for the diet! We arrived around 3pm so the lunch rush was over and it was relatively empty. They appeared to be understaffed as we waited a few minutes to be acknowledged but that's because the hostess was bussing a table, seating a party before us and taking their drink order??? We were sat and waited a few minutes, which was fine but I wished someone brought water immediately- it's freakin' hot outside!  But during that time, we perused the menu and I immediately was drawn to the bottomless rootbeer float. My bf and his son opted for an Oreo cookie shake and a banana shake.  Of course I sampled theirs. I preferred the banana one over the Oreo but both were super thick and creamy.  I got a cup of clam chowder to start along with a turkey burger and added pepper jack cheese.  It had a lot of spice with the cheese, chipotle aioli, and well seasoned turkey patty. But let's talk about the "cup" of soup.  Really more like a thimble. A pretty, square thimble but within 2-3 spoonfuls it was gone and when the check came for the said "cup" it was $3.29- seriously?!?! My bf liked his Southern Charm Burger and his son liked his that was topped with a fried egg.  If you didn't want regular steak fries you could select something else. They both had sweet potato fries, which were good- I got onion rings which were better! When the check came, I thought $60 was a little high for 3 people at a casual restaurant but then again we all had a shake and "upgraded" our fries to something else at $1.49 a pop, it adds up but the glaring overcharge was the soup.  I was kicking myself for ordering it but lesson learned.  However,  I did have a second rootbeer float and took it to go so it balanced out.

My husband and i went out with friends Thursday night for a nice burger and bottomless fries and to our surprise our experience wasn't pleasant. We got seated after 6 min no prob then took a while to order drinks. My friend asked the waitress how long it would take to order a burger and fries since we were trying to catch a movie she said 15 to 20 minutes. so the four of us went ahead and ordered our meals it took  45 minutes to 50 minutes to come out and when it did we had to ask for a check and to go boxes at the same time. We literally scarfed down some of our food to make it in time . And didn't get to enjoy it AT ALL  Unfortunate.

It was OK.  Had the Turkey Burger which was really good (you can customize it) along with broccoli.  A friend ordered a burger, fries and broccoli (certain fries and broccoli are unlimited).   The service was great.  The waitress was very attentive and food was brought out pretty quickly.  You can customize your burger which is a nice feature.  For a "fast food" type burger they are a little pricey.  It's nice than say a five guys and they have a much bigger menu.  I wouldn't go out of my way to go back however I would go again.

The food was delicious! The Service, on the other hand, was lousy! Took 20 minutes to get our food. Server never once checked on us after that. No unlimited fries, no drink refills. No extra napkins.  And therefore, no tip!  Sounds like we aren't the only ones that have had the same experience.  Perhaps they aren't hurting for customers.

I love the burgers and fries at red robin; they are awesome!  My poor review is for the frustration of being constantly hounded about a loyalty card!  They asked at the hostess station "do you have a loyalty card, do you want a loyalty card" 10 seconds later the waitress asked "do you have a loyalty card, do you want a loyalty card" No, I don't and I can find burgers just as good, at a less frustrating restaurant.

We walked out since they told us to sit outside it would be 10 minute wait. We then sit and wait 20 mins. Where we ask the status of our seats they tell us our names aren't even on the list and we now have to wait an additional 45 mins to be seated. POOR SERVICE!!! Update: so I went in after this experience and what can I say this one wasn't any better we stood up front while the staff chatted in the back. There was no one manning the hostess station to seat people. The restaurant was DEAD. Our food comes out in 45 minutes.....again there were all of ten people in the restaurant. It was so dead we could hear the staffs conversations in the kitchen. After waiting 45 minutes for our food  I was about to tell them to cancel our orders but as I approached the kitchen they were finally bringing out our food. When get our food our French fries are cold. Since  the food took forever to come we didn't have time to eat all our food and had to get to go boxes otherwise we would have missed our movie. Please see attached picture of empty hostess station. I'm still waiting on someone from red robin to contact us from the last bad experience. Update to the update: So Jacqueline the manager contacted me and and advised me and my wife to back for a complimentary meal on the house. So we decided to  take her up on her offer. And I must give credit where credit is due. Jacqueline made every effort to make sure we were comfortable and got our food & drinks on time. Her customer service was beyond excellent. Red robin should consider themselves fortunate to have such an attentive manager on their payroll! Thanks Jacqueline we will be coming back!

This was my first time eating in any Red Robin. The burger (I forgot what it was called but it had BBQ sauce and onion straws) was pretty good. It wasn't too greasy. I also ordered the garlic fries (which are unlimited). The fries were okay, nothing special. If you run out of fries, you can just ask the server for more, and you do not get charged for them. Nobody at my table had to ask for more fries; the server beat us to it. The service was great and very attentive.

Instead of fighting traffic we pulled into Broward Mal and chose Red Robin. We were greeted with a warm and friendly smile. We sat in the bar area to watch the football game. The server/bartender was funny, patient and attentive.

Love Red Robin.  Waiters are so nice. Food comes out fast. Sandwiches are huge. I go with a friend. And we both get different sandwiches and then give each other half. So we can each taste both because there is just so much to choose from.

Awesome experience at this location.  We usually eat at the Pembroke Pines location but I can't remember having an experience as good as the one at this location.  The server was very attentive,  the food came out fast and we were able to pay our bill at our table  when we were ready using the tablet they have installed at each table. It breaks down the bill and allows you to pay a tip in a few minutes.  Hubby and I loved visiting this location and plan to come back many times to come.

Horrible experience. My husband and I were excited to go here for the first time last night. We walked in to a full waiting area. I glanced around and saw many open tables. Ugh oh, bad sign. We went up to the hostess desk. She didn't greet us just asked how many barely looking up from tying a balloon to a stick (no idea what that was for, but the rudeness continued). "There's two of us." "Ok 15 mins" "Don't you want to take our name?" She rolled her eyes, sighed, and said, "I guess!" And then started fiddling with the iPad in front of her. If we hadn't been starving and excited to try red robin we would have walked out. Another girl appeared and suggested we take a high top at the bar. Sure, fine. Our server was on point, knew the menu and polite. The two stars I gave this review was for the first half of her serving us. We ordered and waiting about 10 minutes for our food which was fine.... Except my cheeseburger was only slightly warm. My husband's was fine. I would have sent it back if our server had ever returned. In the end I just ate half of it and finished my fries. We paid using the table computer as our server still hadn't appeared. She did show up in time to say "have a good night" when we were already heading for the door. Won't be back.

We were quite happy when this location opened as we normally had to visit Pembroke Pines or Fort Meyers for a burger fix.  (Some might remember a Red Robin in Coral Springs in the 90's) The star of the menu are the many burgers offered and specialty burgers from Food channel.   The challenge is remembering you can change buns and sides as desired.   The fries are steakfries and all you can eat but try to order them crisp.   The chicken sandwich and Prine Rib sandwich are nice also.  The kids love the new meatballs with cheese dipping sauce.   They have a very good Reward program available also.  Kids love the frozen ice cream cake desert. Only a couple items that challenge a better rating.  First, they removed the Pub burger with ale soaked onions !!   Second they removed the all you can eat Mac/cheese for kids and went to a small portion.  Finally they removed the French Onion and homemade chips.  So many great offerings that move away to frequently.

Went on a Thursday nite with my husband and 2 year old granddaughter. Place was empty at 5:30pm. with only 2 tables of customers. Took forever for the waitress to take our order and bring our drinks. That should have been a clue of the service! The lettuce on my salad was wilted and the chicken on the stick for the baby was cold. She brought out a small fries after we were done eating and they were ice cold. The waitress was just awful! After asking for the bill she said it is in the automated table computer. She never came back to get the money. We gave it to the hostess as we walked out. The only reason I gave it one star is my husband liked his burger . Will never go back there. Pines location is 100% better.

This is my first time ordering from this restaurant, the girls in the office order food, I was only in the mood for Soup, so I asked the girls to order me a chicken tortilla soup, she got the bowl . When I got to the office and she handed me the soup, it felt very light, when I opened the soup, it was half empty, I asked the girl if perhaps she had spilled my soup, she replied no, so After work I came over and demanded my refund, the manager on duty stated he had to give me back gift card, I said NO, I paid cash therefore I want my money back, he went to the back got my money and came and handed it to me. I personally will not go or order from there anymore , its not about the money but I expected a bowl of soup, not half, it showed the person preparing the soup didn't care much about the customer
Service is horrible. Slow is not the word. One hour after being seated all 3 burgers came out cold! First and last visit for us!

Place had trash on floor. The waitress was just so so at best. We rarely saw her while we were there in fact she's not the one who brought the food to us. Also they had the pay at the table machine which I can't stand what happened to good old fashion service and having the wait staff do everything for u. The food itself was good and I ordered the burnin love burger which came with a large jalapeño pepper on top which I thought was cute and no I did not try to eat it even tho I like spicy foods I think that would of been to spicy for me.

Stopped by this location after doing a little shopping in the mall. I'm going to chalk this experience up to mismanagement. There was not enough staff on hand to service the customers. My order came out incomplete and the normally fresh burgers were lack luster. I suggest trying another burger spot

While I never expect 5 star service from fast food, I at least expect 3. This experience started off bad, shouldve taken the cue then to go else where. The hostess did not greet us for about 5 min after we arrived. We watched her chatting with the bartender. When she finally came to greet us, she told us she would have to go find us a table. Funny, because we saw about 10 right in the front. What she then did was go and talk to the bartender some more. She came back to seat us and sat us in the OPPOSITE direction from where she came from "looking for a table". Nice, she apparently thinks we are blind and dumb. We sat down and the server was right there, asking us for our drinks. Our order of an iced tea and coke took 10 minutes to bring. We put in our order: a burnin love and a bbq burger, along with a side salad with vinaigrette. 15 min later the side salad came out....with ranch. The server dropped it off and left so fast that I didnt get to ask for the vinaigrette, so I ate the salad with a small amount of the ranch. The food came about 15 minutes after I finished my sad little salad (which apparently cost an extra $4.49 for a handful of lettuce with a sprinkle of cheese and tomato). The food was hot, but it wasn't anything that I would be dying to eat again. The server checked on us 2 more times and dropped off an iced tea to go, for which I was grateful for. Thank heavens you can pay at the kiosk on your table otherwise I fear we wouldve been stuck there another half an hour. The place was not even busy. I say go there ONLY if you have a lot of time to kill and you aren't starving.

In general I do enjoy Red Robin as I think they have some pretty tasty food. I especially like the fact that when you order a burger you get those unlimited fries. Unlimited fries, you heard me. And the fries are good- always nice and warm and lightly salted- yum. That being said, every experience I've had here has not be great. The service man, the service is just not good. Slow is being kind. I've gone here and from start to finish its taking about 90 minutes to eat. And it's usually on my lunch. Not a fun thing to have to explain to my boss that I'm hanging at Red Robin waiting for my food before I can come back. It's frustrating because during a lunch rush I know places are busy but it shouldn't take that long to get an order through. I've never gone here at dinner time because I kind of feel like the same thing will happen. I don't feel like just sitting there waiting for a refill and waiting for my meal. As much as I love their burgers and that basket of unlimited fries, my time is worth more. Until I know they've sped up their processes I definitely will not be back.

I called in my to go order and when I came to pick it up they had not placed the order.  So as I sat waiting for my order another person came to pick up their order.  I watched Samantha realize she had not placed that order either and then placed it and told the customer "it'll be another 10 minutes because the kitchen was backed up" (lying) then as three people waited for their take out orders the two bartenders talked loudly to each other about how some one in the back told them to run their own since that's all they will do anyways. Then my order came out missing two things and when I told the lady she literally did nothing.  Im sure it's because the other girl was helping me not her so she'd figured she'd make me wait for the other girl to help me. O the serving days...when you talk shit loudly for customers to hear.  But I guess that's what you get for dining at red robin.

OMG.... What juicy burgers and forget about the endless fries!!!! Off the hook service and our food came out hot and just the way we ordered it!!! It takes about 15 minutes for your order to come out... The wait staff kept checking in on us and constantly refiling our drinks... Go Red Robin and we look forward to our next visit for your delicious burgers!!!!

Today I am reviewing my preious review about Red Robins. My past experience was horrible but I was invited back to give them another chance. If your looking for great service there ASK FOR JOHN!!!!!!!!!! He was amazing! John is very friendly and super attentive.  I went from giving this place a 2 star to a 5 star because of John.  I'm very big on customer service and he is perfect. The food is always great there in my opinion it's the service that's the problem. If you want great food and even better service make sure John is your waiter.  My fiancé drinks a lot of coke so when we got there he told them to keep the cokes coming. Instead of waiting for my fiancé to keep asking for refills John brought him a pitcher of coke! He made sure that we got everything in a timely matter, it our food was okay, if we needed anything.  I'll definitely will be back to dine there on the days John is there!

Do I even have to give a star??? Where do I start, waited for 10 minutes for a waitress then after she acknowledged us she went missing AGAIN before we could even order a drink! Waited an Hour for cold fries, watered down lemonade and uncooked burgers!!!  Had to ask twice for refills. She NEVER came to check and see how we were doing or to bring us a refill on our bottomless fries!!! Waitress stayed sitting at the bar doing who knows what HOWEVER she was very prompt when coming with the check! I ALWAYS leave a tip she got NOTHING! If you are great at customer service and looking for a job I'm sure they are hiring with that sorry service!!!!

The two stars are for the bottomless steak fries and my whiskey river bbq burger being decent even though it was NOT cooked medium!  Service is horrific and made my first experience with them my last!  Friday night, it's 7:30 and the restaurant is 1/2 empty should have sent me running but I had some gift cards burning a hole in my wallet and a burger craving like nobody's business.  Start with a pushy waitress/loyalty program sales rep yapping about loyalty blah blah blah.  Dang let a girl sit down!  Ordered some drinks and a couple of mediocre apps and they did come pretty quick surprisingly but of course after the waiter drops and dips I realize there is no silverware, napkins or plates...Great!  Now it's a flipping ghost town with no one in sight! 10 minutes later after eyef&@$ing the manager at the hostess stand he told the waitress to bring it...I just could go on and on about my experience but you've read all the complaints from everyone else here so apparently things aren't gonna change here anytime soon!!  Too bad so sad!

Wasn't good to say the least. The hostess and our server was very polite and friendly however took an hour to get our food. Our appetizers were cold and the burgers were mediocre. Two other tables had same issues and one left before their food even came. Was very disappointed and will not be coming back.

This place have the most horrible customer service that I cannot even begin to describe. We took my little cousin here for his birthday because he love burgers and this is not a birthday party that he will remember. It was a group of about 14 family members and they gave us one waitress that miss orders, placed food in front of incorrect people in addition to having  an attitude when I asked her to correct things. It took them about two hours to bring the food out some of the family members got soooo frustrated they walked out. They still failed to feed two of the kids. Ask for the manager at least 4 to 5 times the manager was avoiding our table all night therefore I personally walked in the back of the restaurant where they serve the food and waited until I saw the manager. When he came out I approach him and I said sir we have been requesting you all night to take care of our table what is going on? I told him everything that had happened he never once apologize his response was we normally do not take parties this big. I said that is fine, when we entered your facility you should have advised us and we would have taken our money elsewhere. He was like of course not We can't turn you away. I said well if you can't turn us away and you want to do business at least give us the proper service you see us coming in with birthday balloons and gift bags obviously were celebrating something. At that time I was so frustrated with him I asked for the corporate number. He said OK where are you guys tickets, he gave everyone a couple dollars off their meal which I did not think it addressed any of the issues and then stated this is not my store I am the manager for Pembroke pines so if you're down there stop in and will take good care of you. Basically saying he doesn't give a shit about this store or the customers. I'm just here for one night however if you come down to my store to help build my gross margins will take great care of you. This was the worst experience I have ever had in the restaurant if I could I would give it zero stars.  so I wanted to provide an update to my review after writing this review red Robin contacting me in regards to the horrible experience I had at the restaurant. And offered me a redo of my experience. Today me and my kids went to red Robin and they started off on the wrong foot immediately providing me with same waitress from the first experience I immediately requested a replacement waitress. Once the new waitress came to our table she was welcoming and very friendly. She took our orders in the food came out exactly as we ordered it. The one thing that I would have liked her to come and check up on a table to ensure that we had refills with our food. The manager came by twice to just check on us to make sure we was OK which is a complete turnaround from the first experience where I had to request a manager five times. Overall the second experience was not bad but I still cannot give this company a five star rating because of the horrible first experience that will forever stay with me but I do respect the company for reaching out to me to try to make things right thank you red Robin!!!!!

Where  do I begin?  We went in on a Sunday night to have dinner and they were only fairly busy. We were seated at a two top in the middle of the floor way in the back where it's very dark near the entrance into the kitchen. The location of the table was horrible and I was in the path of the wait staff trying to go in and out of the kitchen constantly I felt the breeze of the people on my back every time they were passing by with trays of food.  We asked to be moved, but were never accommodated.  We ordered burgers and fries and when it arrived, we asked for ketchup and were brought one tiny little Ramekin. I also asked for mayo and I was told that they do not have regular mayonnaise but she would go back there and see what she could do. Really? A burger place that doesn't have mayonnaise? Surely I can't be the only one that eats a burger without mayonnaise. and those bottomless fries?  Yes great.... After you eat the 6 or 7 that they bring you, you have to ask for more, that is, if you can find her, and ask her to bring you more, which we eventually did, with an eye-roll and then she took about 10 minutes to bring us a small batch of some more to share.  So much for bottomless. So much for getting any more ketchup. as for my mayonnaise, she finally emerged with one Ramekin of "gourmet" mayonnaise in which she promptly told me there would be a $0.50 charge for it because it's not a regular menu item.  I was apalled, but of course we took it even though I was halfway through my burger at that point.  Drinks refilled once and that was toward the end of the meal. It's very dark, brighter lights are desperately needed.   The wait staff needs to be trained on how to serve more people quicker. In the end, she presented the check and then all of a sudden had loads of time to stand there and robotically recite to us the whole spiel about how to join their frequent diner program and how to go online and register. By that time we were so over the whole place we weren't interested but there was nothing we could do to shut her up. We let her finish and left her materials on the table we paid the bill and left.

If i could give this place no stars i would. I called for the deal of the day and was told to drive out of my way ans come to the restaurant just to ask about the deal. When i got there i was greeted and then told to go ask the bartender for the special. Really?? Let me do your job for you. Awful customer service. I will definitely not be eating here!!!#

Updated review (10/19/2016): Following my previous review, I was contacted by customer service and they offered me a $25.00 gift certificate. This past weekend (10/15/2016) we were in the neighborhood and since we had the gift card, we decided to give this place another shot for an early lunch before our 1:30 movie. Upon arrival, we were seated promptly, at one of the tables in the bar/lounge area. Our server Lisa was also the bartender, and she did a great job of making us feel welcome. The service experience during this visit was 180 degrees different from our last visit, in a positive way.  Unfortunately, in other ways things didn't go well. One of the items we were interested was the Asian burger on a Ramen Bun - which was on the menu, but apparently sold out and not available any more. This put an immediate damper on our spirits, why wouldn't they note on the menu or better yet, change out the menu, rather than get our hopes up? There was a notation on the menu that this was a limited time item, but it was pretty disappointing. I ordered the Fiery Ghost Tavern Double, which came out missing key ingredients (they left off the fried jalapenos for crying out loud.) She got the Nacho Crunch tavern double - which was missing the cheese sauce, so at this point they're 0/3 with us this visit in the food department. Our server and the manager jumped right on correcting the issues, we got cheese sauce for the Nacho Crunch, as well as some fried jalapenos delivered almost immediately upon request, and manager showed up and offered me a replacement burger. All of this took a bit more time than we'd anticipated but the replacement burger was tasty. To reiterate, our server Lisa, and the manager did a fantastic job. The service was all anyone could ask for. Once the kitchen's mistakes had been rectified, we felt that the food was "ok", and while we were happy with the service ultimately the experience did not live up to our expectations. Not sure if this is due to the mall location and the somewhat captive audience this represents or if this is a thing with this chain. Overall, we have decided that there are too many places that we'd rather spend our money to return here. Original rating stands as-is. ******* Quick Review: Food good but not amazing (and over-priced). Service lackluster to poor, just barely better than cafeteria ambiance. Rated two stars because the food was adequate. We arrived and found the host stand deserted. An employee who was just arriving came in the front door and ignored us for a minute before realizing that no host was coming to seat us. She never acknowledged us, but to her credit she did find someone to help us.  On the way to the table, our hostess had to change plans three times, because the restaurant was a shambles of uncleaned and unbussed tables. We ended up at a poorly-lit two top in the back adjacent to the kitchen...and the restrooms. We were left with the assurance that our server would be with us shortly - but five minutes passed without so much as eye contact from any of the staff before we saw anyone, and that was the woman who seated us. She apologized for the delay and took our beverage order - and promptly brought us the drinks. After another five minute wait, our server finally arrived. It was at this point that I realized we had problems... the table next to ours was leaving because they'd been sat and ignored. Our server left us to get the manager to speak with them and then when she reappeared she proceeded to show she had no idea how to do her job. Luckily I am a 10 year+ front of the house veteran of the service industry and managed to gently prompt her into taking our order, because she was clearly unprepared for such a complex task as taking an order for two hamburgers and french fries. For our starter, we ordered the Voodoo Fries, which sounded interesting. Fries, queso, blackening seasoning, fried jalapenos, bacon and ghost pepper sauce. These arrived after a 10 minute wait and, while a little light on flavor and heat, they weren't bad; the portion was smallish for the price, but it was enough for two. Our entrees, when they arrived, were tasty, though both burgers were over-cooked. The rest of our visit was without major incident, and we left in relatively good spirits, if dissatisfied.

Ordered a to go order. One item was a side caesar salad. We checked the order before leaving and luckily we did because it was a grilled caesar salad. They said they would fix it so we waited (we also had a 3 piece tender and a crispy chicken salad). Wait about 5-7 mins and get the caesar salad, it was just lettuce and some cheese with dressing, no croutons or anything. This was definitely not worth the $5.79 that we were charged for the grilled salad. Not sure how much a side caesar costs but comparing it to a side house salad we paid $1 more and no one offered to adjust the price if it is indeed cheaper than the grilled salad (which I think it should be since it was literally just lettuce and some cheese with dressing). Not worth almost $6 at all.  When I asked if it came with any croutons they said they would bring us some of the little breads to put on the salad so we waited again. This time waited about 5 mins and nothing yet so we left. Didn't want the other food to get cold and after being there for 10 mins we felt like we could've just saved time and gotten better quality food dining in.  Also I don't know when Red Robin changed the tenders that come with the kids meals but they are NOT up to the same quality as the ones that come with the adult meals. These tasted like frozen reheated ones I could buy from Costco. Not crispy and the meat inside had hard parts that I had to spit out while I was eating. Like rubbery parts of chicken. The tenders on the main menu taste much better and it used to be the kids tenders were just a smaller quantity of the main menu ones, not a completely different, lower quality tasting tenders. I go to red robin a lot (normally always dine in) and this to go ordering experience was very disappointing.

Horrible service.  Not even sure they should have been open when I went in this Wednesday night.  Order wrong, missing waitress, food over cooked and also cold, expensive, and they try to rip you for $2 to use their on-table order machine which didn't say anything about a charge for use, but sure stuck it on my tab.

Went here for the first time today. The service was really slow and the server messed three parts of our order up. When the manager came over he didn't really care that we were having such a bad experience. So sad because we normally love red robin.
Food is always consistent.  Service is generally good, but I always sit in the bar and have the same waitress who is fantastic.  I love the bottomless fries.

The review is solely based on this location. I have not been others, but this was my first experience for a Sunday night family feast.  It has a Applebee's feel with a full bar. It was suggested to me to try the strawberry lemonade because it is so tasty. Needless to say, our waitress could not keep up with my refills   I ordered a spicy southwest salad which came a cut of chicken and a lot of avocado (my favorite). No complaints there, but we were with my girlfriends sister who is allergic to almost everything under the sun. She specifically ordered a chicken sandwich with no cheese and the waitress/cooks got it wrong so they had to remake it. There were six of us at the table and five of us finished our meals before she received her new chicken sandwich. It was a little aggregating that one simple request could not be fulfilled. We flagged down the manager and he didn't charge us for her meal which was generous, but at the same time I now know why there were only a handful of people in the restaurant at dinner time.

I've been to Red Robins in the past, and as a whole I've been satisfied with the chain. My parents were in town and were craving some of the strawberry lemonade and big juicy burgers, so they decided to go here after a quick Google search. Even after being here for 4+ years and having gone to the Broward mall a million times, I was unaware that this location even existed. When we drove up on a Sunday afternoon/evening, the location was eerily empty. Been to some red robins where you have to wait 30 to 40 minutes for a table in the middle of the day. We were seated towards the back, right near the kitchen door. Our server came out in a few minutes to take our drink order, which went down without too much hassle.  My sister has quite a bit of food allergies, so it took her several minutes of inspecting the food menu before deciding what she could eat. She decided on chicken sandwich without cheese and several other ingredients and the sauces on the side. The rest of us ordered some burgers and some salads. We were promised "bottomless fries" with the orders-not a bad gimmick. She needed it since her order came out exactly the way it came off the menu.  Bottomless fries came in handy for her, as she insisted that the rest of us eat to avoid having her food get cold. Our meals weren't too impressive, my "Avo-Cobb-O" salad had a really weak amount of avocado on it. I put more avocado than that on a turkey sandwich. We had all finished (and we aren't animals that eat insanely fast) before my dad got fed up. A manager happened to be walking by at a pristine moment asking how we were doing tonight, to which the answer was "my daughter still hadn't gotten her food after 40 minutes, and we are all finished".  The manager immediately tried to remedy the situation, comping the sandwich and then it was delivered to the table in under 90 seconds. This tells me that the kitchen staff is REALLY resting on their laurels that even the refire wasn't out to the table quickly, but as soon as the pressure was on from management it was immediate. The place had nobody in it to warrant the amount of time it took, or the fact that it was messed up to begin with seeing as the tickets were either entered incorrectly or made wrong. We didn't shaft the tip of the waitress seeing as it likely wasn't her fault and it was fixed, but overall it was really irritating and I see now why the place is dead on a day which should be one of the highest grossing days.

This place just can't seem to pick a direction and go with it.  It's either really good, or it makes you wonder why you bothered.  This was one of those second kind of visits.  My daughter had her coupon for her free birthday burger, and we can't resist that.   We got there early (about 6:00), so it wasn't crowded for a Friday and we were seated right away.  We had sat there for a good 5 min., before anyone came by to offer us drinks.  She brought them back, but we weren't quite ready to order, since there were a number of new things on the menu.  She said she would be back in a couple of minutes.  It was probably 10 min. before we finally decided to turn on the red light on the electronic box on our table.  Finally she returned and took our orders. So, we waited......and waited.  By the next time I looked at my watch, we had been there for 45 min. and still no food.  I was just getting ready to leave when she wandered by and said it would be right out.  It was only a couple of minutes more.  Then there was the issue of no silverware.  We had to turn on our flashing light again.  She said she'd be right back.  She wasn't.  After another 5 min. or so, my daughter went over to the bar and asked them for silverware.  It took a couple of min., but she got back with it before our server ever did. I decided to branch out and try something different, so I ordered the Banzai burger.  It was supposed to have grilled pineapple and teriyaki sauce.  The pineapple has no signs of being grilled.  It was like they had taken a cold slice out of the can and slapped in on my burger.  There was no hint of teriyaki sauce.  I considered trying to flag her down and have her bring some sauce, but I didn't want to be there until closing. My husband ordered the wings with the buzzard "sauce."  I put quotations around that because there was nothing in the way of sauce on the wings.  They had been coated with something and fried, but were completely dry.  They had about a teaspoon of bleu cheese sprinkled on the top, but that was it.  I thought wings were always served with dipping sauce, but they weren't here.  He only ate a few of them, and they used to be his "go to" order at RR.  My daughter ordered the ramen burger, but didn't really like the ramen "bun" because the noodles weren't seasoned. Overall, it was just a really disappointing night, which is too bad.  When this chain does what they're supposed to do, they can make some very good food.  I think it's going to be a very long time, if ever, before we go back.....at least to this location.

This was my first time at Red Robin, ever, and we went on 8/7/16 about 8:45p.m. so close to their closing hour. The manager helped us out with information and drinks and took our order and he was amazing. I wish I could have gotten his name. The waitress assigned to our table must have had something better to do - and she must have wanted to go home on time. Maybe we were in her way, dunno. But we had to remind her to refill our drinks, she didn't even introduce herself by name and we hardly saw her around to get her attention about the missing ketchup or anything else we might want. When we ordered our third round of lemonade (it was REALLY good!) she said "Did you want that in to-go cups?" and I said "no, I'm gonna continue eating his fries thanks. I just needed something to wash it down." She assumed we were leaving. At that point, her tip was sliding as far as we were concerned. I would have RATHER tipped the manager. He was fantastic and just well worth the name "customer service"! Food-wise it was really, really good. I had the Cheese Burger and fries and my honey had the chicken sandwich and garlic fries (which were quite tasty) and my friend had a burger that had bleu cheese I think on it. Over-all I would come back but maybe not so close to closing time and if I get the same waitress, I'm moving tables. Period. So, yeah, a no on her service but a yes on the food!

If there was an option for zero stars, that would be the proper rating. It took 15 minutes for our server to come over to the table once we were seated and fifteen minutes to get a round of waters. Then, it took one hour and five minutes for HALF of our orders to arrive. The other 2 arrived (wrong) when everyone else had finished. Finally, one hour and twenty-three minutes after I ordered my food, it arrived. We asked to see the manager. He could not have possibly cared any less about the poor service or the incorrect orders. In fact, I have never met a manager of a restaurant that was as terrible as this guy. Everything about this place is absolutely HORRIBLE! Awful! Also, the restaurant was absolutely empty (for good reason), so there was absolutely no excuse. DO NOT come here! Go anywhere else. Heck, just skip lunch or dinner instead of coming here. Trust me, you'll thank me later.

My grandson is 4 yrs old . I Love Him So Much. He tries me though.. Lol. He gets hungry you feed him what he wanted and he eats None Of It!  This is why I felt the Need fro make a comment. We Went school shopping for Summer 8 yrs. D. J. 4 yrs.  Stopped at Red Robin for Lunch. Well the waiter made it so much Fun picking lunch for kids DJ was all excited. Summer had chicken and Mandrian oranges. DJ had pizza and Apple slices. 2 cups for each. He ate Everything.
